description.narrative: Relevant social services in health, nutrition, HIV, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and child protection are provided through schools and other non-formal learning platforms, and linkages strengthened to relevant services in the community., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Environmental Sustainability, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Hiv Prevention, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Sanitation, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-aged girls and boys, especially early adolescents (aged 10-14) [in targeted districts], acquire essential learning outcomes and practice skills for life, are safe from exploitation, harmful practices and violence, and benefit from integrated social services (including in emergencies).

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Climate change/environmental education, awareness and advocacy
Data/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use for nutrition in middle childhood and adolescence
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Education and training in water supply and sanitation

Prevention of undernutrition in adolescence (10 to 19 years)
Services to prevent or respond to gender-based violence in emergencies
Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Adolescent health and nutrition
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring
Water supply - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Relevant social services in health, nutrition, HIV, WASH and child protection are provided through schools and other non-formal learning platforms, and linkages strengthened to relevant services in the community.

description.narrative: Over 300,000 adolescents, particularly girls, received protection, nutrition and health services through school-based interventions. The success of these programmes encouraged delivery of more services to children, including C4D, HIV and WASH, using the school platform. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of adolescent girls and boys provided with services to prevent anaemia and other forms of malnutrition through UNICEF-supported programmes
Number of girls and boys in and out of school, who are reached with violence prevention, referral and response services through UNICEF supported Safe Schools Programme
Proportion of adolescents (10-18 years) who have comprehensive knowledge about HIV/AIDS
Availability of a C4D Strategy for Education
Number of pupils with access to basic WASH services in schools in the reporting year with UNICEF direct support
